body_html: @aselle, @protoget, in some cases where shellcheck raises false positives, I can silence them by adding a comment. It would makes things easier for me here as there are a lot of warnings... but I'd like to know if that would be a problem to add such comments to the source code ?
body_text: @aselle, @protoget, in some cases where shellcheck raises false positives, I can silence them by adding a comment. It would makes things easier for me here as there are a lot of warnings... but I'd like to know if that would be a problem to add such comments to the source code ?
body: @aselle, @protoget, in some cases where shellcheck raises false positives, I can silence them by [adding a comment](https://github.com/koalaman/shellcheck/wiki/Directive). It would makes things easier for me here as there are a lot of warnings... but I'd like to know if that would be a problem to add such comments to the source code ?
